reviews.text:
ðŸš£Rower's Bay Park is located next to Yishun Dam (Yishun Ave 1).
It's a part of the Round Island Route (RIR).
ðŸš£A centerstage at Rower's Bay Park is the boardwalk that winds close to the water edge of the Lower Seletar Reservoir.
ðŸ¦¤A wetland thriving with cattails and lush vegetations at the boardwalk area provided a welcome sanctuary to wading birds like white-breasted waterhen and grey heron.
ðŸ¦†At Rower's Bay Park, there are nice clean Toilets, drinking water coolers and drinks & snack vending machine.
ðŸŽ£Rower's Bay Park is another great location for anglers to hone their skills and try their luck.
ðŸª¦Located on a small mound next to the public toilet (another one) at the end of Seletar Club Road is a century old gravestone of Jane Buyers, wife of John Craig Buyers, a ship builder who co-owned a small ship repairing dock at Palau Brani called Bon Accord Dock in around 1886.
ðŸŒŠFun fact:
Lower Seletar Reservoir is a popular ground for kayaking and dragon boat enthusiasts.
Rower's Bay was named after this popular activities.

Tucked away in one corner of Lower Seletar Reservoir near the Yishun Dam, Rower's Bay Park is a hidden gem that ought not to be missed. Quite a number of people come here for fishing in the morning, and it is the place from where we can check out Yishun Dam itself and Seletar Fishing Village with its four jetties. Unfortunately, we were not allowed to go in to explore the Fishing Village. But standing in the middle of Yishun Dam and facing the Straits of Johor, we were able to see one of the four jetties of the village - the leftmost jetty called Jenal Jetty.

By the way, in case you're wondering what the pink substance near the shoreline of the park is, they are the pink-colored eggs of golden apple snails.

There are people walk, cycle with their family and pets along the reservoir. Also plenty of people go fishing. It's a nice part for family relax during weekend. If the weather is good, that's one of the best place to photograph the sunset! I advise to arrive before 5:45pm. Then you can take a nice place to see the sunset because there are quite a lot of people if you arrive too late.
Beautiful sunset at Rowerâ€™s Bay Park which is part of Lower Seletar Reservoir. The sky is clear and we and many visitors were able to enjoy this beautiful scenery. Nice time to have a picnic.
Small park and a scenic sunset spot
